00015 
00016 #ifndef EXCEPTIONHANDLER_H
00017 #define EXCEPTIONHANDLER_H
00018 
00019 // We forward declare PEXCEPTION_POINTERS so that the function
00020 // prototype doesn't needlessly require windows.h.
00021 
00022 typedef struct _EXCEPTION_POINTERS EXCEPTION_POINTERS, *PEXCEPTION_POINTERS;
00023 
00024 int __cdecl RecordExceptionInfo(PEXCEPTION_POINTERS pExceptPtrs,
00025                                 const char *lpszMessage,
00026                                 const char *lpszAppMagic,
00027                                 const char *lpszAppVersion);
00028 
00029 
00030 /*
00031 // Sample usage - put the code that used to be in main into HandledMain.
00032 // To hook it in to an MFC app add ExceptionAttacher.cpp from the mfctest
00033 // application into your project.
00034 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00035 {
00036     int Result = -1;
00037     __try
00038     {
00039         Result = HandledMain(argc, argv);
00040     }
00041     __except(RecordExceptionInfo(GetExceptionInformation(), "main thread"))
00042     {
00043         // Do nothing here - RecordExceptionInfo() has already done
00044         // everything that is needed. Actually this code won't even
00045         // get called unless you return EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER from
00046         // the __except clause.
00047     }
00048     return Result;
00049 }
00050 */
00051 
00052 #endif
